intro: Eryngium pamiralaicum, commonly known as the Pamir thistle, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage. The plant produces small, purple flowers arranged in a spherical inflorescence, typical of the genus Eryngium. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh mountain climates. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
